definition: to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: The jury convicted him of theft.
sentences.chinese: 陪審團宣判他犯有偷竊罪。

sentences.english: When the jury pronounced him guilty of murder, john did not bat an eye.
sentences.chinese: 當陪審團宣判約翰犯有謀殺罪時，他面不改色。

sentences.english: The judge told the prisoner the jury had acquitted him of the charge of bigamy.
sentences.chinese: 法官告訴犯人陪審團撤消對他重婚罪的指控。

sentences.english: The jury sided with Christofferson-Titchbourne, awarding her thirty-nine million dollars.
sentences.chinese: 陪審團站在朱莉一邊，判她應得3900萬美元。

sentences.english: He was convicted by a jury.
sentences.chinese: 他被陪審團裁定罪名成立。

sentences.english: A defense lawyer says Jufer was intoxicated at the time of his crime.
sentences.chinese: 律師以他那富有感染力的辯護說服了陪審團。

sentences.english: The grand jury has been abolished in England and in approximately one-half of the states in the U. S.
sentences.chinese: 大陪審團在英國以及美國大部分州已經被廢除了。

sentences.english: A Magistrates’ court sits without a jury.
sentences.chinese: 治安法庭審察時沒有陪審團。

sentences.english: The jury brought in an acquittal .
Jury selection begins today in O. J. Simpson's latest trial.
sentences.chinese: 今天開始挑選辛普森一案最新審判中的陪審團成員。

sentences.english: The verdict of the jury was given in his favour.
sentences.chinese: 陪審團作出了對他有利的結論。

sentences.english: He chose to stand trial by jury.
But he is wary of filming witnesses, and draws the line at juries.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他很擔心證人入鏡，也不允許陪審團被拍攝。

sentences.english: Some courts use anonymous juries, meaning that jurors are identified only by number.
sentences.chinese: 一些法院採用匿名陪審團，即用數字代號標識陪審員。

sentences.english: The jury arrives at its verdict in the seclusion of the jury room.
sentences.chinese: 陪審團在隔離的評議室裏作出裁定。

sentences.english: Want to learn more about how the jury deliberates?
sentences.chinese: 想了解更多關於陪審團審議？

definition: judgment (by a court of law)/to pass judgment on/to sentence
Sir Donald Tsang or Tsang Yam-Kuen (1944-)
preliminary hearing/interrogation (of a suspect)/preliminary examination (of a project etc)
